::Prowl::

Prowl grins at Iron Raptor's words, ignoring the pain that shot 
through his wing from the vibrations of her running.

"That wouldn't be too bad. Maybe a mouse or two," he replies, 
grinning but then frowning. His repair system was done on major 
internal damages, but it was not going on to his wing. He turns his 
head to look at the wing, watching it swing off the attatched part of 
his wing. It wasn't losing too much fuel, but it would serioustly 
disturb him for a while. It wasn't a major wound, so his repair 
system didn't bother with it.

Reaching behind him, Prowl's hand takes hold of the top of his wing, 
snapping it off with a sharp motion. He clenches his teeth slightly 
from the pain shooting from the disembodied wing. Placing the wing on 
his back, he closes his other wing over it, shutting off mech fluid 
flow to the stump.

"Ok, let's get there as soon as possible," he says serioustly, 
leaning down and taking hold of Iron Raptor's neck. He was ready for 
her to go full speed, he just hoped he wouldn't fall off.






--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> I'm posting at school and the bell just rang, I'm afraid I didn't 
have time 
> to post with Desmonus.
> I will when I get home.
> Happy posting everyone!
> 
> 
> IR:
> 
> * Iron Raptor could feel Prowl shifting on her back, and she had to 
admit it 
> felt very strange.
> Even in her other beast modes she had never had anyone ride on her 
back 
> before...now she knew what a horse felt like.
> By the tense feeling of Prowls muscles against her own she could 
feel that 
> he was uncomfortable about something, maybe...ashamed?
> But then again he did manage to crash into a tree and break his own 
wing, so 
> she only guessed as much would be proper.
> 
> Iron Raptor looked over her black shoulder as Prowl spoke, seeing 
his repair 
> system activate...but wondered just why he wasn't afraid of 
her...or even 
> thought that she was disgusting by now.
> All he ever showed was concern, and she guessed that it was right 
for him to 
> feel that way. She would be the same if this was him instead of 
her. But 
> then again, she wouldn't wish this on a Pred.
> Well...maybe a Pred...
> 
> Iron Raptor turned her head back towards the direction of the Ark.
> Hurry, that was what Prowl said...but she wondered if he could even 
hold on 
> tight enough. Well...she could always find out.
> It would be a long way too. There were a few gullies and fissures 
on the way 
> there, but they should make it by nightfall if she ran all the way.
> She growled at Prowl, in a slight sarcastic tone.*
> 
> " I suppose you want peanuts and complimentory drinks on this 
express 
> transport as well...Sir?
> 
> * Then breaking into an easy trot before a smooth jog. She would 
wait until 
> he was fully repaired before she ran out fully.*
